responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Potential command injection in automation scripts
    analysis: |
      The automation scripts `automation/build-artifacts.sh`, `automation/check-merged.sh`, and `automation/check-patch.sh` all use `rpmbuild` with user-provided arguments. If an attacker can control the input to these scripts, they might be able to inject arbitrary commands into the `rpmbuild` command.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - automation/build-artifacts.sh
      - automation/check-merged.sh
      - automation/check-patch.sh
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Potential command injection in automation scripts
leads.analysis: The automation scripts automation/build-artifacts.sh, automation/check-merged.sh, and automation/check-patch.sh all use rpmbuild with user-provided arguments. If an attacker can control the input to these scripts, they might be able to inject arbitrary commands into the rpmbuild command.
